question: A 2 kg ball is thrown upwards with an initial velocity of 20 m/s from ground level. What is the total energy of the system when the ball reaches its maximum height?

A 5 kg object is initially at rest on the ground. It is then lifted vertically to a height of 20 meters and acquires a velocity of 3 m/s at that position. What is the change in the object's total mechanical energy during this process?
A book rests on a table. Which of the following statements correctly describes an action-reaction pair involving the book?
options: A) The Earth’s gravity pulls the book downward , and the table pushes the book upward
B)The book exerts a downward force on the table, and the table exerts an upward force on the book
C)The book pushes the table , and air resistance pushes back on the book
D)The table supports the book , and the book’s mass creates friction
correctAnswer: B）The book exerts a downward force on the table, and the table exerts an upward force on the book
solution: A:The reaction to Earth’s gravity is the book pulling up on the Earth, not the table’s normal force. C:Air resistance is unrelated to the book-table interaction D:The table’s force and friction are unrelated Third Law pairs.

question: A rubber ball strikes a wall and bounces back. Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: A) The total momentum of the ball and the wall is conserved.
B) The momentum of the ball is conserved.
C) The momentum of the wall is conserved.
correctAnswer: A The total momentum of the ball and the wall is conserved.
solution: A:Momentum is always conserved in a system if no external forces act. The ball-wall system is isolated during the collision, so their total momentum remains unchanged

question: A uniform 4-meter-long beam of negligible weight is balanced at its pivot. A 6 kg mass is placed 1 meter to the left of the pivot. What mass must be placed 2 meters to the right of the pivot to keep the beam in equilibrium?

A motorcyclist traveling at 90 km/h on a straight road suddenly notices a traffic signal 75 meters ahead turning red. If the rider's reaction time is 0.4 seconds, what is the minimum deceleration required to stop safely before the signal?

When a person pushes against a wall, the wall pushes back with an equal and opposite force. This demonstrates which law?
options: D) Law of Conservation of Momentum

i) Velocity	ii)  Initial speed	iii) Final speed	iv) Mass

options: A) Increasing the volume while keeping temperature constant.
B) Decreasing the volume while keeping temperature constant.
C) Increasing the temperature while keeping volume constant.
D) Adding more gas to the system at constant volume and temperature.

question: What happens to the pressure of a gas if its volume is halved while temperature remains constant?

Assume no friction and have air resistance.When a man stands on the Earth, pushes the box forward with his hand, what will happen?

question: When you are scrolling reels/shorts/tick tock, if you push your finger from bottom to top of the screen on an iPhone 4, what will happen?Assume no friction.

question: Marcy pulls a backpack on wheels down the 100m hall. The 60N force is applied at an angle of 30° above the horizontal. How much work is done by Marcy?
A 30,000-kg freight car is coasting at 0.850 m/s and it crashed with a 10,000 kg train .  What is the final velocity of the freight car?
What is the velocity of a 900-kg car initially moving at 30.0 m/s, just after it hits a 150-kg deer initially running at 12.0 m/s in the same direction? Assume the deer remains in the car.

A tennis ball is struck such that it leaves the racket horizontally with a speed of 28.0 m/s. The ball hits the court at a horizontal distance of 19.6 m from the racket. What is the vertical height of the tennis ball when it leaves the racket?

A nurse pushes a cart by exerting a force on the handle at a downward angle 35.0° below the horizontal. The loaded cart has a mass of 28.0 kg, and the force of friction is 60.0 N.What force must the nurse exert to move at a constant velocity?
When an object is projected vertically upwards, its velocity is ___ at the highest point.
i)backwards ii)forwards iii)downwards
Which of the following statements is true about Newton’s FIRST Law?
options: A) An object at rest remains at rest unless there is an unbalanced force acting on it.
B) The net force acting on an object is equal to its mass times its acceleration.
C) For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
D) Mr Man is very cute.

question: Mr Man and Mr Hung both run from A to B. Mr Man has an average speed of 1ms-1 and Mr Hung has an average speed of 2ms-1. Which of the following must be true?
options: A) The magnitude of Mr Hung’s average velocity is higher than the magnitude of Mr Man’s average velocity.
B) If they start at A at the same time, Mr Hung will reach B first.
C) The displacement of Mr Man is the same as the displacement of Mr Hung.

question: Box A of mass 30kg and Box B of mass 3kg were released from rest in vacuum. Which box will reach the ground first?
options: C) They reach the ground at the same time
